intro: Secamone leonensis, commonly known as the Leonese secamone, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces berries that contain seeds. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
